We are a collection of innovative minds building the future, one day at a time. Together, we create technologies that take society further. We’re looking for people with the skills and vision to build a better tomorrow.Join our Transmission Solution team as the MEP Site Engineer and help us re-imagine the world by finding solutions and making the world a smarter place for tomorrow. Your Role – International, Challenging And Future-Oriented! MEP Site Engineer will be part of project execution team of BU Transmission Solutions, which is responsible for execution and completion of Grid Stations projects in line with time, cost, and quality requirements of the contract. We are looking for a MEP professional with ability to handle project MEP works with knowledge of construction / installation sequence.  Collaborate with architects and project teams to develop MEP system designs that meet project requirements and codes.  Provide tendering support specifically for the building services elements.  Review in detail tender documentation conditions, scope of work and specifications for Lighting and Small Power, HVAC, Firefighting, cranes etc.  Prepare and issue tender stage enquiries to Subcontractors and analyze returned offers to ensure compliance with contract specification and at optimized cost.  Establish a comprehensive " Division of Responsibilities" for each project on case-to-case basis clearly defining the "Extent of Scope" for MEP sub-contracts.  Establish design / drawings and material submission / deliverable schedule with suppliers in coordination with design coordinator on each project and ensure submission are made as planned.  Meetings with supplier & client for early / fast submission, review and approval along with design coordinators  Provide technical design support in coordination with other disciplines.  Review and respond to Subcontract design submissions and liaise with Client.  Review and agree Subcontract monthly valuations.  Review the MEP calculations / models and drawings with applicable tools / softwares for correctness and optimization before submission to the client.  Weekly report the MEP submissions / approval status - actual vs. planned and mitigation measures for delays if any.  Review and advise on main Contract and Subcontract claims and variations.  Supporting the Civil Site Manager/ Supervisors or Mechanical Supervisors regarding installation of the building services installation on site and ensure compliance with the approved Construction drawings and technical specifications.  Coordinate on site building services activities with other disciplines  Notify the Civil Site Manager in the case of discrepancies and propose swift and economical solutions.  Prepare daily, weekly and monthly site progress reports.  Obtain and review method statements and risk assessments well in advance to avoid delays during constructions.  Attend regular site meetings with subcontractor(s) to ensure availability of required material and resources.  Responsible for implementing QA System established on the site.  Ensure use of current drawings only and file superseded drawings.  Issue approved red marked drawings to suppliers to produce As built.  Maintain records and reasons for delays during construction stage.  Maintain and agree resources engaged on “Day works” after authorization from the PM/CCM.  Submit As built to client and obtain approval.  Record, register and maintain all field changes for easy reference.  Maintain the records of actual progress with respect to agreed programs with O/E and with Subcontractors and initiate actions to mitigate delays.  Create detailed plans, specifications, and drawings for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems.  Coordinate with contractors and subcontractors to ensure proper installation and compliance with design specifications.  Oversee the MEP aspects of construction projects, addressing any issues or changes as they arise.  Ensure all MEP systems comply with local, state, and national building codes and regulations.  Ensure MEP sub contractors comply with HSE requirements during execution.  Stay up to date with industry standards and best practices.  Assist in the development of project budgets and monitor expenses related to MEP systems.  Identify cost-effective solutions without compromising quality.  Conduct inspections and quality control checks to ensure the MEP systems meet the required standards and specifications.  Maintain accurate records, documentation, and reports related to MEP systems and project progress.  Promote safety measures and environmentally sustainable practices in MEP system design and installation.  Abide by and comply with the Company code of ethics, business conduct and HSE requirements. 
 Your Qualifications And Skills – Digital And Solid!   Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or electrical Engineering (or related field).  3-6 years of experience in MEP engineering and design (Overhead Crane, Small Power and Lighting System, HVAC, Fire Fighting System – Alarm, Fire Suppression System, Fire Deluge System, Fire Hydrant System).  Strong knowledge of building codes and regulations.  Excellent project management and communication skills.  Ability to work collaboratively in a team and manage multiple projects simultaneously .
